title: Quick LoL Thoughts: January 17
body:
Hi folks,
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
**Usual Disclaimers**

These posts will often contain talk about future work we're doing, or planning to do, that isn't yet guaranteed to ship. The nature of the work could change or, depending on what we discover, projects mentioned may get delayed or even stopped. If you'd like to see a Tweet whenever a new one of these posts goes up: https://twitter.com/RiotMeddler


http://ddragon.leagueoflegends.com/cdn/6.24.1/img/champion/Ziggs.png              
----------------------------------------------------------------------------     
**Format change for posts this year**

Hope 2020 is treating you folks well so far! As part of this first post of the year I wanted to start by talking about a format change we're doing. From today onwards instead of a weekly post from me we'll instead be doing alternating weeks of posts from myself and RiotScruffy. My day to day at work doesn't involve as much interaction with the SR and Champion teams as it used to when I started these posts. A lot of the topics you folks want more context on are from the work of those teams though. As a result Scruffy's going to cover the work of those teams more than I will, talking about things like state of the current patch on SR, balance plans, how new champions have landed etc. My posts will be taking a broader look at topics across LoL as a whole. with some overlap on SR topics but less focus on things like recent/upcoming balance changes.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------       
**Blue versus Red win rates post preseason**

One of the metrics we keep an eye on when making large changes to LoL is how win rates for the two sides of the map are affected. Different queues (blind pick, flex, solo/duo etc) have different trends, as do different regions. For today I wanted to share some data on Ranked Solo/Duo primarily post preseason. Historically Blue side has had a slight advantage in ranked on SR, preseason changes however have removed most or all of that edge though, depending on which region you look at. Increased importance of dragons is what we believe has driven this change, given Red side has better dragon access than blue. Overall it's a result we're quite happy with for ranked.


https://imgur.com/a/dYsR1uw

.

https://imgur.com/a/Pr9S4h5


.

https://imgur.com/a/ega2HLB

.

https://imgur.com/a/9T3zSEn



Blind pick also shows red side performing stronger post preseason. In that queue however red was already favored. 


https://imgur.com/a/cvtfm1R

While it's tempting to assume that's due to draft champ select favoring blue over red Flex queue shows the same trend as blind pick, suggesting other factors are significant as well or instead. We're going to dig into non Solo/Duo win rates by map side a bit more to figure out what's going on there.  


https://imgur.com/a/Q1lDpEG



----------------------------------------------------------------------------         
**Continuing with no mid-season this year**

In 2019 we decided not to do a large midseason patch, keeping the game more stable mid ranked season and putting dev time instead into other work like preseason. Looking back at 2019 as a whole and player response to that decision we think that was the correct call so will be doing the same this year. We realize for some players with a preference for more frequent large changes that will be a bit disappointing. Overall consensus from feedback we gathered was very strongly in favor of a more stable mid year period though hence the decision.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------         
**Clarity focus this year**

By contrast something we'll be looking to do differently this year is focusing more on clarity, both in and out of game. Upon reflection it's something we don't feel we've done as well at as we should have recently so we'll be making it more of a priority over the course of the year. Examples of issues we'll be looking to improve include things like clarity of spell visual effects for new champions, ease of understanding how event passes work, ability to follow combat in TFT, removing unnecessary complexity from abilities/items etc. 

That will be a focus across the year as a whole, rather than a single set of changes, so will be a gradual process. Wanted to call it out though since I know it's something on a number of your minds as well and feedback on how we're doing throughout the year would be much appreciated. 

----------------------------------------------------------------------------           
**Event Improvements**

Another focus for us right now is improving our event experience, with our hope being that each large event we do this year has some clear improvements in it. Current thinking involves things like:

* Making sure we've got a temporary game mode for each event as per the recent Gameplay and Ranked Dev Video
* Improvements to Event passes and missions. Reduction in grind needed and more missions completion flexibility for the recent Night and Dawn event seemed to go really well for example and we think there are some other ways to improve those elements further.
* Story and theme having a stronger presence throughout event experiences. Still figuring out approach here but want to take a shot at this goal throughout the year.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------             
**TFT Pass**

Finally for anyone wondering which TFT rewards they'll still be able to unlock this Set - there are about 8000 points still to come. If you're chasing that final egg as a result for example it should still doable provided you're at or above the 8000 mark right now.

replies.body:
One big important question, 

Since Riot has been delaying the creation of truly dedicated AP Bruiser items for years now and the last time I got a response about why AP Bruiser items were not added this preseason like originally promised last year I was told that we would get them sometime this season, but since you have just started that there would be no big Mid-season patch does that mean AP Bruiser items have to atleast wait until next preseason? I just want clarity since these items have been delayed for years and you guys have admitted that Mordekaiser and other Bruisers are giving kits that have to have ways to make up for the lack of itemization.

I was wondering about those karma changes. Her base damages aren't really the thing that her solo lane needs. Her RQ explosion damage isn't satisfying to pull off and her ratios just promote her to build support.

I really think that she needs some ratio buffs because building full AP and seeing mid-game damage numbers don't feel good. It'll also help keep support karma in line because they rarely ever build full AP ( and if they do they're spending more money than they got for it).

Ever since her rework Riot has made a blatant disregard to her being a fun and healthy solo laner. They have and are going to continuously force her to be a support and nothing anyone says can change their mind. I had to deal with my favorite champion being slowly ripped away for me for years, but giving up on her was my best decision because nothing me or anyone else in the Karma community could change Riots ideas for forcing Karma to only be a support.

Karma changes are intended to be a small buff to her early power specifically (hence rank 1 damage up). We're avoiding ratio buffs at least at present to avoid heavy AP builds late game being as effective as we've seen in the past given the problems that's created.

Cool, but just out of curiosity: Is it a mandatory design for Karma to be an early game champion? 

Because Karma sounds like she'd be a lot healthier to play against, and a lot more fun to play, if she wasn't an early game champion...
She's by default stronger than many other champions early game because she gains access to her ultimate at lvl 1.
True, but that doesn't mean Mantra can't be tuned down at level 1 so it doesn't give as much of an advantage via base stats.
AP Karma has been problematic? How? Like, more than her abusive tankbuilds or RE spam builds?

>avoiding ratio buffs at least at present to avoid heavy AP builds late game being as effective as we've seen in the past

When was ap karma mid ever a broken pick? Besides that one patch where you troglodytes decided to double her e duration for no reason, I dont recall her pick rate or wr getting above 50%. Also how is karma doing damage with item investment problematic? It is central to her champion design. I dont understand why her q needs to have a worse ap ratio than nami bubble. I dont understand why you want to relegate the champ to being a shield bot. There are other ap utility champs like zil and morg, why is karma the only one of these champs you are giving the shaft?

So it really is just you guys want her to only use her E, you don't want to buff her ratios because she's just not allowed at all to do some damage

Can you guys rework her because it is blatantly obvious that no one at Riot knows what to do with her and the reasoning 'it's hard because theres so many people with different playstyles' isn't relevant because you're only changing her based on just Support Karma, whenever any other version of Karma is slightly strong you nerf her

> [{quoted}](name=Raiokun,realm=NA,application-id=A7LBtoKc,discussion-id=obERLZ8Z,comment-id=000f,timestamp=2020-01-17T17:48:30.138+0000)
>
> I was wondering about those karma changes. Her base damages aren't really the thing that her solo lane needs. Her RQ explosion damage isn't satisfying to pull off and her ratios just promote her to build support.
> 
> I really think that she needs some ratio buffs because building full AP and seeing mid-game damage numbers don't feel good. It'll also help keep support karma in line because they rarely ever build full AP ( and if they do they're spending more money than they got for it).

Replying to my own comment here, but let me just say, I understand that they don't want to give karma late game damage scalings. She can instakill a carry and then take one third out of the support. In all honestly, that doesn't feel right as karma.

I'm sure after hours of reading the forums they know that they messed up with karma's Ionian fan service by making a highly skilled battle mage into an afk enchantress. But at least they're planning something, I hope.

It was often said she was going to get a rework to fix her but each time that died out and the poll from last year had Shyvana on it, despite her having two reworks before karma had one. The only thing we can do is hope that we might find some sort of peace in 2021, because **the only way that karma's problems are going to be fixed is if they have an entire rework for her kit**. Namely, lower her passive and put in her R, and give her a half battle mage half enchantress passive that rewards both sides of gameplay.

Just don't flame them too much for throwing a bandaid over an amputeed arm.
Can we have any Shyvana progress update, even on future thoughts?
She's still on our shortlist of likely VGU candidates. Nothing beyond that to report at present though.
When you guys work on Shyv, can you also work with J4. As the prince(/King?) he doesn't look look visually very Demacia like

Hi Meddler ! I would love to see more stats from Riot directly ! These articles are really interesting and I'd love to have more stats available !

Also, concerning Akali, is there a way to change her without completely destroying her like the patch notes suggest ? ...

We'd like Akali to be a reasonable pick for the average player. The current shape of her kit though means she skews towards really high MMR and pro play and if balanced for them will be pretty weak elsewhere on average. We're making some functionality changes to make her weaker there, goal being to then put power back in in ways that don't bias her balance towards such a small group of players.

The problem is that she is going to need buffs somewhere to make up for these mechanical changes. This will absolutly gut her. I do think it is the right direction, but after nerfing her in other ways a million times and then now changing her functionality it will probably kill her.

I also think it's likely she'll need buffs somewhere to compensate. We've cut a lot of stuff off Akali post VGU though and she's remained an ongoing problem, despite concerns that each round of nerfs would definitely kill her. For this round would much rather cut hard and then see where she lands rather than speculative buff at the same time and increase the odds we buff incorrectly and extend problems further.

I'm a player who derives a lot of my fun from playing highly engaging, mechanically difficult (and rewarding) champions. My favorite things about Akali and Sylas were learning their more difficult mechanics, and feeling like I was rewarded with an edge over my opponent for my effort put into learning. I understand that I'm in the minority, the "small group of players", but I've noticed an overall design philosophy that seems to avoid this kind of complexity -> power paradigm.

Azir, Ryze, Irelia, Akali, Sylas, I understand that efforts (lots and lots of efforts!) have been made to balance them without reducing their complexity, but it feels like we've given up on that now, and the new plan is to reduce complexity and make these champions more boring and easier to balance at the expense of skill expression translating into a power advantage. 

Is that the case?

Hey Meddler, I don't think you guys realize that you slowly make Renekton a minion right now in the meta, there has been so many things that affected him if its healing reduction buffs, conq reworks, tanks getting buffed and basically everything is getting buffed and updated except him. He's really bad right now and his winrate is somewhat low but it would be so much lower if he didn't counter popular champions such as Yasuo, Irelia, Riven and even Sett now, high pick rate champions, that rise his winrate because he counters them, but they also have a high ban rate. Please consider reworking Renekton since this is very disappointing and frustrating to see this happens over and over every patch when I see 0 changes made for him
Ah, thanks for that image formatting boards, that's definitely exactly what I was trying for.

Hey Meddler, hope you enjoyed your holidays. 

This question is probably a shot in the dark at this point, but can we please get some context on the current Karma buffs on PBE?

Increasing her base damage seems like something mostly beneficial for tank Karma... and that's really not something we want.

Could you give at least a single example of the clarity improvements you want to make? It'll be nice to have Yetter writing these, your posts have been really far removed from gameplay topics. Like, you haven't talked at all about Sett, Aphelios or the Diana rework except in extremely broad terms like winrate and "yeah this is a thing that's coming/happened."

Sure. Please note these are the sorts of things we're aiming to do, but not guaranteed projects or necessarily happening immediately.


* More use of loud visual effects for the player casting a spell, quieter ones for other players (avoid visual noise overload in team fights).
* Better visualization of the upcoming rewards for events (could involve a track like the TFT pass
* Simplifying item tooltips, condensing power on items into fewer, more power effects
* Ensuring new skins don't change character silhouettes as much as a few recent cases have
I feel like mecha kingdoms really suffered from this problem because they all do look the same ingame to me.

Talking about clarity, there are a couple of points that have bugged me  for many years now:

* **It is not clear how strong stacking champs** like Veigar, Nasus, Kindred, Bard, Rengar, Cho Gath, Senna & Sion  at any given point of the game,unless you are keeping track of their actual performance in game (as opposed to having a HUD component that indicated the number of stacks they have)

* Unless I use third party websites I can't know (at least to my knowledge) that actual ability ratios of any ability, making it harder for newer players to come up with possible fun builds or optimize their current ones
Hey Meddler as part of the clarity pass, is one of the candidates for better clarity Aphelios. As a pretty complex champ he seems bound to have a lot of burden of knowledge

For Aphelios we're working on a few things:

* Improved VFX clarity for some spells
* Better visualization of secondary weapon he has ready for enemies
* Adjustments to some gameplay edge cases (e.g. multi target ults, mini chakram interactions etc)

A lot of our clarity focus will be on making sure future content hits the mark, or that systems as a whole are clearer. We will be doing some clean up for cases like Aphelios as well too though.
Stop making new champs and fix your game.

Don't make Akali's R1 point and click, I'm okay with the other nerfs changes. But making point and click is stupid. The champions that struggle the most against Akali are melee, making R1 point and click won't solve that, it will just make even worst range champions matchups, also good luck getting to the back line on a team fight with a point and click R1 with 575 range.

I agree that Akali needs nerfs or adjustments, but making her ult point and click will just make people stop playing the champion. Don't kill Akali...

Hey Meddler any plans on buffing jungle or at least reverting it? Currently falling behind in the jungle feels absolutely terrible with no real way to come back especially since solo lanes will pretty much will always be out leveling you (even duo lanes in some cases).
{{champion:44}} {{champion:11}} Taric yi 66%win  need nerf

> Format change for posts this year

In that case, please think carefully about which week Scruffy should get. If the players are all asking questions about SR and Champions when it's your week, and none when it's his, that will be an issue.

First guess is, it's better if Scruffy takes the week just after a new patch, so the patch changes are still fresh in mind, as well as the reveal of the planned changes on PBE, so that's what most players will talk about. That leaves the mid-patch post to you, to talk about more general stuff.

What do you think?

Based off past experience players ask balance/SR/Champion questions constantly no matter which week it is or what the original post was about :)

Agree with your overall point though! Scruffy starting next week puts his posts in a position to talk about the patch that just went out and plans for the patch that's still mid development.

Thoughts on the Akali mini rework.

I am one of the many Akali players who are annoyed at the upcoming changes Riot wants to do.
Ok, so the main reason why Akali is nerfed right now is because of her escape potential. But by revealing her in her shroud you practically remove it completely, since a lot of the champions have AT LEAST one immobilizing ability. You could as well rename her w to be "Energy Restore". And on top of that, is shreud that strong? It's on a 23 seconds cooldown, you can throw 3 Lux bindings in that time without having to worry about Akali desapearing into her shroud.
She is a squishy Ap assassin, how would you expect her to survive going in and even manage to cast one ability if she dies immediately without her stealth.
Akali is a mechanically difficult champion, she is good at outplays but if she gets behind, she can't even do damage anymore. If she can't dodge with her R1 anymore, how do you expect her to outplay anyone.
Akali is only strong for veteran players, why take all the hard work they've put into this champion and throw it away.
The assassin class is made for champions who go in, take out one primary target, and get out in the blink of an eye. If you remove all her escapes, how do you want her to get the job done?
Her win rate in diamond is 46%, does she really deserve a nerf?
People have been complaining about Yasuo's wind wall since ages, but that is what makes him Yasuo, being able to block, jump around and dodge is the essence of the champion. Just like Akali's in and out style, with dashes and stealth is what makes her Akali, being able to surprise the enemy from behind and then go back in your shroud is what makes her special.
Any chance of eventally having a way for us to get missed skin border+icons?
Any planned changes for sylas? Seems like the rework was somewhat successful but he seems a bit on the weaker side(both from global experience and stats), would you agree?

When are the new game modes in LoL coming out?

If you have resources to make other games, you have resources for game modes like Nexus Blitz.

If you have resources to put out 5 skins/3 chroma lines every patch you have resources for game modes like Nexus Blitz.
How has Lee managed to avoid being nerfed despite consistently overperforming over the last couple weeks/months while Qiyana, who is a lot less contested at the highest levels already gets nerfed?

Hey meddler can Lissandra have her q cooldown reverted please? There are really important combos and gameplay that you cannot access before 45 cdr (20 mins in) whichit takes away from her ability to build ap. She currently feels like diana but still not a champion after level 6.

If her pushing is really a huge issue you could just reduce the damage to creeps by a % early and have it decrease as the game progresses. Please please please consider this there is so much skill expression that is locked away when her q cooldown is too long like it is now. She can't kite and cannot reliably combo her qs with her cc which was the general method of playing her before.

Now she's just a passive bot and you hope the enemy team screws up instead of being able to generate your own leads if you played well mechanically.

Please make her playable again.
Did Zyrachanges do their job?

Hey Meddler, what do you think about Kindreds state right now ? Do you think she needs some compensation buffs because of the jgl XP and gold nerfes since she is heavy reliant on these both ressources ?

Hi Meddler, whats your opinion on the recent change to jungle since preseason. Main point being catchup EXP being removed and making some dominant junglers and others not viable at all. Also with the recent change to drakes do you think top lane needs more attention even though rift herald is getting cut down its HP?

On clarity, I’ve been wondering whether Riot has ever thought about adding more clear timers to inhib respawns. I understand that there is the ring that circles the inhib but I don’t think it’s nearly as readable as things such as drag or baron.

Since Scruffy will be handling things that pertain more to the SR Team and the Balance Team, and you're handling more overarching LoL stuff, let me ask a question that maybe you could compile into a future post:

Omnistone has been out for while. Could we get some statistics on a mastery curve for Omnistone? Like how many games a player needs to play with it to master it? It's my belief that the keystone has a lot of skill expression, and I wanted to see if this is true. Maybe compare it to other high skill keystones like Spellbook and Predator, see how their mastery curves differ?


If this isn't possible, could we at least see what champions are performing well?

Cheers!

PogChamp this is probably more of a Scruffy question but are there any goals to expand/support more classes/variety of champs? A lot of people say "AP bruiser" but I was thinking more so meele bot laners, and jungle enchanters.   (Yasuo and Ivern currently have absolute control of these identities)

Will you guys ever (in the near future) update/buff Brand so he can become a midlaner and can leave bot lane? I'd love to play him solo lane, but at this point it is just trolling to pick him other than as a support.
Any thoughts on the state Skarner so far this season? He is seeing a rise in popularity in top lane.

Have you guys been keeping an eye on Lux since her VFX update? The added clarity to her skillshots made them easier to dodge, leaving her in a not great position. Not to mention whatever bug she's suffering from that resulted in her getting disabled in the LEC's first week.
Any plans or work for Irelia in the foreseeable future given the gap between high elo/low elo and the fact that she has been pushed more towards mid lane than top lane after conqueror rework?
